result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A. Towsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Pay restitution to the victims in both 14CF59 and dismissed/read-in case 14CF54.  Amounts are $454.70 in 14CF59 and $2000.00 in 14CF54.

Provide DNA sample.  

Pay court costs, including the DNA surcharge.

Participate in all ordered assessments and follow through with recommendations, including such assessments for drug and/or alcohol dependency.  Court suggests that agent determine if psychological evaluation and anger management are necessary.  

Obtain full-time employment or attend school on a full-time basis.

0 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
May be served in the Wisconsin prison system. This sentence is consecutive to the sentence/s Defendant is now serving. No credit. Defendant to be allowed good time on this sentence.
Consecutive to: existing sentence/s

records.addlTxt: revoked - sentenced to prison
Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

01:37 PM Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with Attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA Harper - State's recommendation is for 1 year initial and 1 year ext. supervision, consecutive to any other sentence Def might be sitting. Atty. McDougal asks for the same except that the sentence be concurrent with anything the Def is serving. Court noted that judgments have previously been entered in favor of the victims for restitution in this and other matters read in at the time of sentencing. Def addresses the Court. Court sentences as follows: 8 months jail, consecutive to any other sentences. With good time, that's a 6 mo sentence. Def not entitled to any jail credit at this time. Sentence will be served in the prison system as Def is in prison now on another sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 23, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

Petition and Order Permitting Attorney to Withdraw

one doc for 2 cases (14CF54 & 1CF59). Scanned into both, stored in 14CF54
Criminal complaint from dismissed/read-in case 14CF54 attached to this case for transmission to the DOC as part of the JOC in 14CF59.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with attorney Gregg Earl Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  PSI has been received by the Court.  DA addresses the Court with details of recommendation - prison sentence of 13 mo initial conf. and 27 mo ext. supervision, imposed and stayed for probation of 3 years with 4 mo condition time.  Atty. Waterman addresses the Court re the recommendation of the parties; asks that sentenced be withheld rather than imposed and stayed and that expungement be allowed with successful completion of probation.  Def addresses Court.  DA notes that def was not afforded expungement in Sauk Co. case.

Court rules on sentence for 14CF59, noting that the Court considers the dismissed/read-in charges of 14CF54.  Court notes difficulty accepting the joint recommendation, based on info the Court has received through the PSI.

Court asks if Richland County has a restorative justice program.  DA - it does not; not sure this case is appropriate for such.

Sentence:
Noting rehabilitation as a primary goal, Court does not order def to prison at this time.  Court accepts parts of jt recommendation but rejects others, for the following:  

Sentence withheld for probation of 3 years.  Conditions:  restitution to both victims, $454.70 in 14CF59 and $2000 in 14CF54.  Pay court costs including DNA surcharge.  provide DNA sample.  Participate in all ordered assts and follow through.  Court suggests that p/p determine if psych. evaluation necessary and whether anger mgt is necessary.  Participate in any assts, including those for drug or alcohol dependency as well.  Obtain full-time employment or attend school on full-time basis.  Court does not order jail time as a condition.  If revoked on probation, Def will come back before this Court for sentencing.  Court states expungement is not appropriate.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.

Felon admonishment provided - lifetime prohibition of firearms and suspension of voting rights until restored.
Sentencing hearing at 02-26-2015 09:00 am
email directive from Crawford County JA re. scheduling
email request from DA's office to reschedule the Dec. 29th sentencing; no objection from the defense; Jan. 16 at 9 has been suggested by the Crawford County JA
Statement of Negotiated Plea
Sentencing hearing on December 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody, appears in court with attorney Gregg E. Waterman.  Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Two cases called together (14CF54 & 14CF59). Atty W. presents documents to the Court. Court reads statement of negotiated plea, plea before the court is 14CF54 be dismissed and read in, 14CF59-nc plea for 40 months prison, 13 init confinement, 27 extended supervision, imposed and stayed for 3 years probation, 4 months jail as a condition along with other conditions. Court's colloquy re. plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.Court is not willing to go forward with sentencing today, will order a PSI. Comment by Atty Waterman. No objection by DA. Further colloquy. Def pleads NC to 14CF59. Court finds factual basis and accepts NC plea, finds plea was freely, voluntarily and intelligently made, accepts waiver of rights. Court finds def guilty for count 1 in 14CF59. Motion to dismiss and read in 14CF54. Court dismisses 14CF54. PSI will be ordered for 14CF59.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Gregg E. Waterman in court for Defendant Charles A. Towsley. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA gives status of case, offer has been given to defense. Requests plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.
